verbs.description: pragmatize (third-person singular simple present pragmatizes, present participle pragmatizing, simple past and past participle pragmatized)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To consider, represent, or embody (something unreal) as fact; to materialize.
examples: One of the miraculous passages in the life of Mohammed himself is traced plausibly by Sprenger to such a pragmatized metaphor.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To behave in a pragmatic manner; to focus on the material or practical rather than abstractions.
